item.title: Schwarzschild Radius
item.description:
The Schwarzschild Radius, the black hole warning sign

The Schwarzschild radius—named after Karl Schwarzschild—is a cornerstone in Einstein’s general theory of relativity. It defines the point where our perception of physics and reality no longer follow their usual laws, the point of no return, where nothing—not even light—can escape.

Let’s dive into one of my favorite topics when it comes to black holes!

What Is the Schwarzschild Radius?

The Schwarzschild radius is the radius from the center of mass where the escape velocity of an object equals the speed of light (~1,079,252,848.8 km/h!). This means nothing can escape it. Any object crossing this radius is lost to the black hole, as no information or matter can escape its grip.

item.title: Japanese Progress January 15th
item.description:
Time to Check in on my Japanese Progress!

To preface this series of posts for the next.. I don’t know.. 4-5 months? I’ll be doing an update once a week, reviewing my Anki card progress, that is, how many cards I know and how much my vocabulary has grown, alongside my WaniKani Progress, which is my Kanji learning method.

Well then.. 行こう!

For starters, I am currently on level 4 on WaniKani, which will cover about 30% of the vocab found on sites such as NHK Easy which have simplified Japanese news articles, aimed at aiding those still learning Japanese.

item.title: My Fitness Goals for 2025
item.description:
Just as 2025 is my year to finally conquer japanese, it is also finally my year to get to the weight I want, after being so close last year and then regaining the weight.

The plan for this year is simple, lose 10kg before summer, to get to my ideal body weight of 76-80kg.

Now this is, of course, if very optimistic. But I have faith that my combination of playing Volleybal, running, lifting weights, and the occasional cycling session, all paired with a balanced high-protein diet will definitely help me reach my goal.
